Heading: Sender-defined text
Note: To be used only in circumstances where the parties to an exchange have agreed to include text which (a) is not for general distribution, and (b) cannot be coded elsewhere. If more than one type of text is sent, it must be identified by tagging within the text itself

Heading: Short description/annotation
Note: Limited to a maximum of 350 characters

Heading: Description
Note: Length unrestricted

Heading: Table of contents
Note: Used for a table of contents sent as a single text field, which may or may not carry structure expressed using XHTML

Heading: Flap / cover copy
Note: Primary descriptive blurb taken from the back cover and/or flaps. See also code 27

Heading: Review quote
Note: A quote taken from a review of the product or of the work in question where there is no need to take account of different editions

Heading: Review quote: previous edition
Note: A quote taken from a review of a previous edition of the work

Heading: Review quote: previous work
Note: A quote taken from a review of a previous work by the same author(s) or in the same series

Heading: Endorsement
Note: A quote usually provided by a celebrity or another author to promote a new book, not from a review

Heading: Promotional headline
Note: A promotional phrase which is intended to headline a description of the product

Heading: Feature
Note: Text describing a feature of a product to which the publisher wishes to draw attention for promotional purposes. Each separate feature should be described by a separate repeat, so that formatting can be applied at the discretion of the receiver of the ONIX record, or multiple features can be described using appropriate XHTML markup

Heading: Biographical note
Note: A note referring to all contributors to a product – NOT linked to a single contributor

Heading: Publisher’s notice
Note: A statement included by a publisher in fulfillment of contractual obligations, such as a disclaimer, sponsor statement, or legal notice of any sort. Note that the inclusion of such a notice cannot and does not imply that a user of the ONIX record is obliged to reproduce it

Heading: Excerpt
Note: A short excerpt from the main text of the work

Heading: Index
Note: Used for an index sent as a single text field, which may be structured using XHTML

Heading: Short description/annotation for collection
Note: (of which the product is a part.) Limited to a maximum of 350 characters

Heading: Description for collection
Note: (of which the product is a part.) Length unrestricted

Heading: New feature
Note: As code 11 but used for a new feature of this edition or version

Heading: Open access statement
Note: Short summary statement of open access status and any related conditions (eg ‘Open access – no commercial use’), primarily for marketing purposes. Should always be accompanied by a link to the complete license (see <EpubLicense> or code 99 in List 158)

Heading: Digital exclusivity statement
Note: Short summary statement that the product is available only in digital formats (eg ‘Digital exclusive’). If a non-digital version is planned, <ContentDate> should be used to specify the date when exclusivity will end (use content date role code 15). If a non-digital version is available, the statement should not be included

Heading: Official recommendation
Note: For example a recommendation or approval provided by a ministry of education or other official body. Use <Text> to provide details and ideally use <TextSourceCorporate> to name the approver

Heading: JBPA description
Note: Short description in format specified by Japanese Book Publishers Association

Heading: schema.org snippet
Note: JSON-LD snippet suitable for use within an HTML <script type="application/ld+json"> tag, containing structured metadata suitable for use with schema.org

Heading: Introduction
Note: Introduction, preface or the text of other preliminary material, sent as a single text field, which may be structured using XHTML

Heading: Secondary flap / cover copy
Note: Secondary descriptive blurb taken from the back cover and/or flaps, used only when there are two separate texts and the primary text is included using code 05

Heading: Full cast and credit list
Note: For use with dramatized audiobooks, filmed entertainment etc, for a cast list sent as a single text field, which may or may not carry structure expressed using XHTML

Heading: Bibliography
Note: Complete list of books by the author(s), supplied as a single text field, which may be structured using (X)HTML

Heading: Abstract
Note: Formal summary of content (normally used with academic and scholarly content only)
